BotGoodPushesS Class Reference

A* search algorithm based on estimated remaining pushes number of the pusher. (f(x) = h(x)) Nodes with less pushes are explored first. this algorithm DOESN'T return best pushes solution of this level but only a good solution. More...

#include <BotGoodPushesS.h>

virtual const char * SOLVER_NAME ()
 BotGoodPushesS (Base *base, Level *level, int maxNodeNumber, int maxRamSize, int openTableSize=870967, int closeTableSize=51827, int deadlockedBoxesSearch=2, bool onlyPushNumber=false)
virtual int g (TreeNode *treeNode, int pushCost) const

Detailed Description

A* search algorithm based on estimated remaining pushes number of the pusher. (f(x) = h(x)) Nodes with less pushes are explored first. this algorithm DOESN'T return best pushes solution of this level but only a good solution.

Constructor for a solver of a level

Parameters:
base main class of the game
level Level to be used
maxNodeNumber Limit number of nodes to explore
maxRamSize Limit max ram size to allocate
openTableSize size of Open Table to allocate (hashtable)
closeTableSize size of Close Table to allocate (hashtable)
deadlockedBoxesSearch number of boxes to use when testing every possible positions of deadlock
onlyPushNumber only keep number of pushes in Stats object. don't generate solution Path (CPU saving for deadlocks and penalties)

virtual const char* BotGoodPushesS::SOLVER_NAME (  )  [inline, virtual]

Name of this solver

int BotGoodPushesS::g ( TreeNode *  treeNode,
int  pushCost 
) const [virtual]

In this solver, we use f(x)=h(x) and not f(x)=g(x)+h(x) so g(x) must be egal to 0.

Parameters:
treeNode to be computed
pushCost number of pushes from its parent (usefull for macro-pushes)
Returns:
always 0
